meanings.definition: To bear witness or give evidence
meanings.sent1: She was attesting to what she saw at the accident scene.
meanings.sent2: The witness was attesting in court about the events of that day.
meanings.sent3: The parrot, attesting to the chaos, mimicked the sirens it heard.
meanings.sent4: The old tree, attesting to many seasons, stood tall and wise.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprint on the glass was attesting to someone's presence.

meanings.definition: To affirm to be true or genuine
meanings.sent1: He was attesting his signature on the legal document.
meanings.sent2: The certificate attesting the authenticity of the painting was displayed.
meanings.sent3: The cat, attesting its innocence, purred and rubbed against the detective.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be attesting the beauty of the night.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face was attesting her happiness and contentment.
